task_description: Facing the building to your South-East (approx. 149°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full structure of the main building, so I will look up by rotating the camera to a pitch of 30° to capture the roof along with the lower part of the building.
My current heading is 0°N, which is not facing the target building located at South-East (149°), so I need to rotate right by 149° to reorient towards the target building.
To view the full height of the target building from ground to roof, I need to look up, so I will rotate the camera to a pitch of 30° while maintaining the current heading towards the building.
My heading is now 0°N, which is away from the target building at 149°SE, so I need to rotate right by 149° to reorient toward the target and view its full structure.
I am facing the target building, so I will look up by rotating the camera to a pitch of 30° to view the roof and capture the full height of the structure from ground to roof.
I need to reorient to face the target building at 149°SE from my current 0°N heading, so I will rotate right by 149 degrees to align with the target direction.
I am facing the target building, so I will rotate the camera up to a pitch of 30° to view the roof section, allowing me to assess the full height from ground to roof.

To both face the target building at 149°SE and view its upper section, I will perform a combined rotation: turn right 149° to align heading with the target and pitch up 30° to look at the roof, all in one action to avoid repeated heading resets.

I can now see the target building's full structure (from lower visible sections to roof) by combining the upward view and prior ground-level awareness; estimating 8 typical 3-meter floors gives a total height of 24 meters.
